intro: Xanthophytum setosum, commonly known as the hairy xanthophytum, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. Its leaves are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Xanthophytum setosum is typically found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas.
